important1.definition: to know, recognise, or understand something, especially something that is not obvious
not lying down, and with the back straight rather than bent
to be or become weak or unsteady; to hesitate and be unable to make a decision or choice
a formal set of courses and their content offered at a school or university

important2.definition: a large mass of ice moving slowly down a valley or spreading outward over a land surface
land almost surrounded by water but connected to the mainland on one side
a ring-shaped reef or chain of islands formed of coral
a low triangular area where a river divides before entering a larger body of water
a deep, narrow valley with steep rocky sides, often with a river flowing through it
an area of land drained by a river and its tributaries, often surrounded by higher ground
a long narrow area of high land, often with steep sides
